intro: Steganthera moszkowskii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and dense, velvety foliage. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with contrasting markings. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Its botanical features make it a favorite among horticulturists and plant enthusiasts.
